intro: Psychotria insularum var. aprica, commonly known as the island psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical and subtropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests or disturbed habitats. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth texture and can vary in size depending on the growth conditions.
